longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 6 months from the arrival date. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of emergency or temporary passports.

Visa required, except for Nationals of Thailand who are
spouses and children of Egyptian nationals (SEE NOTE 54062)
(SEE NOTE 57005) . 
    NOTE 54062: Not applicable to holders of emergency or
   temporary passports, who must obtain a visa and security
   approval prior to travel.
    NOTE 57005: Accepted proof of Egyptian nationality is:
   (copy of) a birth certificate, passport or National ID Card
   of the relative.
Visa required, except for Sons and daughters born to an
Egyptian father  (SEE NOTE 54062) (SEE NOTE 57005). 
    NOTE 54062: Not applicable to holders of emergency or
   temporary passports, who must obtain a visa and security
   approval prior to travel.
    NOTE 57005: Accepted proof of Egyptian nationality is:
   (copy of) a birth certificate, passport or National ID Card
   of the relative.
Visa required, except for Sons and daughters of an Egyptian
mother, provided born after 25 July 2004  (SEE NOTE 54062)
(SEE NOTE 57005). 
    NOTE 54062: Not applicable to holders of emergency or
   temporary passports, who must obtain a visa and security
   approval prior to travel.
    NOTE 57005: Accepted proof of Egyptian nationality is:
   (copy of) a birth certificate, passport or National ID Card
   of the relative.
Minors:
- Minors, aged less than 16 years, do not need a separate
  passport, provided they are registered in passport of a
  parent or guardian that does not contain a machine-readable
  zone.
Warning:
- In addition to a visa, housemaids being nationals of
  Thailand require a prior approval from the Egyptian State of
  Security Authorities
vaccination:
Passengers arriving within 6 days after leaving or transiting
countries with risk of yellow fever transmission For details, click here
and not holding a yellow fever vaccination certificate are
subject to quarantine for 6 days.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 9 months of age. 
Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk is very limited. P. vivax
  and P. falciparum may exist from June to October in the El
  Faiyum area. Recommended prevention: none.
